channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Debt-ridden Harris campaign spent $2.6 million on private flights for staff in October: FEC documents
item.description: Kamala Harris' presidential campaign, which is $20 million in debt, spent $2.6 million on private jets in October, according to Federal Election Commi...

item.title: Boeing issues layoff notices to more than 400 workers as it begins drastic cuts
item.description: Boeing announced in October that it planned to cut 10% of its workforce, about 17,000 jobs, in the coming months.

item.title: Netflix’s Tyson-Paul boxing bout gets 65 million viewers at peak
item.description: More than 100,000 users reported network issues on the Downdetector website throughout the livestreaming of the Paul vs. Tyson fight.

item.title: No, Firing Jack Smith Would Not Be an Obstruction of Justice
item.description: Justice Department prosecutors are mere delegates, permitted to exercise the president’s power at the president’s pleasure.

item.title: Why Trump Should Not Turn His Back on the Pro-Life Cause
item.description: Two things can give him the confidence that it is not only possible, but wise, to limit abortion as president.

item.title: Trump nominates fracking magnate and climate change skeptic as energy secretary
item.description: Trump called Liberty Energy's Chris Wright "one of the pioneers who helped launch the American Shale Revolution."

item.title: Biden Promotes DEI-Pushing Air Force Officials On His Way Out The Door

item.title: TikTok parent ByteDance valued at about $300 billion, WSJ says
item.description: A tender offer to employees in October 2023 valued ByteDance at $225 billion, and a December 2023 buyback boosted the valuation to $268 billion.

item.title: Book Review: The M&A Failure Trap
item.description: Massive M&A deals make headlines but too rarely make money for stockholders.

item.title: Vindication for Scott Walker on Teachers’ Unions
item.description: A new study of education in Wisconsin provides evidence that unions protect bad teachers and getting rid of them can improve student performance.

item.title: Trump’s Foreign Policy Agenda Must Start By Undoing Four Years Of Global Insolvency
item.description: American resources are limited. We must address the greatest threats from large, powerful countries like China first, then everyone else.

item.title: Escaping the Benchmark Trap: A Guide for Smarter Investing
item.description: Is it time to eschew the benchmark trap in favor of Warren Buffett's rule, "Don't lose capital?"

item.title: Musk backs Howard Lutnick as Treasury secretary and calls Scott Bessent ‘business-as-usual choice’
item.description: “Business-as-usual is driving America bankrupt, so we need change," Musk said.

item.title: What to know about the congressional push to expand some Social Security benefits
item.description: The House has passed legislation that would provide full Social Security benefits to millions of people, pushing it one step closer to becoming law.
